heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 31 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.4°C) and outside temperature (down 2.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 481.4m higher than yesterday, 136.4m higher than the past week, 70.4m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 696m to 976m and averaged 1316.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
